channel.title: Help compiling please
channel.description:
So I'll be honest, this is my first time trying to run my own server and I'm running into quite a few issues. The main one I'm having at the moment is updating shops and item prices. After editing the files to what i want for the shops and compiling, I get this error message and cannot boot my server.
Error after Compiling [IMG]http://i56.tinypic.com/bf16yv.jpg[/img]
The path and everything is correct, but I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong.
Compiler File [IMG]http://i56.tinypic.com/11hdhtc.jpg[/img]

item.title: Help compiling please
item.dc:creator: @Faderjaxs Faderjaxs
item.description:
@Faderjaxs wrote:

i actually tried after a while of no replys yesterday and completely spaced the path and classpath. I changed them to jdk and voila, server works. Thank you for the help!

Read full topic

item.title: Help compiling please
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“2k9 pking, post:4, topic:408736”][quote author=Faderjaxs link=topic=510014.msg3700690#msg3700690 date=1312737546]

I’m not very good with batch, but should the period be there right after the “-cp”?

The compiler launches and compiles the files correctly and successfully as is, but after the compilation I cannot run the source.

I tried your suggestion, however, and got an error in the process of compiling so I added the period in again after the “-cp”

EDIT: Still in need of help
[/quote]
Have you got the environment variables set up (java) as example
CLASSPATH: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk.1.6.0_26\bin;%CLASSPATH%; (_26 would be replaced with what version of jdk you have)
PATH:C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\bin;
To get to the environmental variables you need to go onto Start>search for ‘System Variables’>Edit Environmental Variables>new(the top one)>Variable name: CLASSPATH> Variable value: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk.1.6.0_26\bin;%CLASSPATH%;. Then do the same for the next one[/quote]
How would it be the variables?? He has errors. Fix those errors.

Read full topic

item.title: Help compiling please
item.dc:creator: @2k9_pking 2k9 pking
item.description:
@2k9_pking wrote:

[quote=“Faderjaxs, post:3, topic:408736”][quote author=Cole1497 link=topic=510014.msg3700665#msg3700665 date=1312736765]
I’m not very good with batch, but should the period be there right after the “-cp”?
[/quote]

The compiler launches and compiles the files correctly and successfully as is, but after the compilation I cannot run the source.

I tried your suggestion, however, and got an error in the process of compiling so I added the period in again after the “-cp”

EDIT: Still in need of help :([/quote]
Have you got the environment variables set up (java) as example
CLASSPATH: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk.1.6.0_26\bin;%CLASSPATH%; (_26 would be replaced with what version of jdk you have)
PATH:C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\bin;
To get to the environmental variables you need to go onto Start>search for ‘System Variables’>Edit Environmental Variables>new(the top one)>Variable name: CLASSPATH> Variable value: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk.1.6.0_26\bin;%CLASSPATH%;. Then do the same for the next one

Read full topic
